summary.overall_findings: Duke Energy's published materials address transparency and oversight, among other responsible AI pillars. For transparency, technical papers detail specific AI models and tools used, such as Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels, while blog posts mention an AI chatbot's ability to escalate complex issues to human agents for oversight. These disclosures, along with evidence for explainability and governance, mean that 4 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars have documented evidence. All four of these pillars are addressed at the policy level, drawing from 14 publicly available sources. No qualifying public evidence was found for fairness, privacy, and 1 additional pillar.
